title: macOS privilege escalation

activities.message:
I noticed this bug while checking the patch for the previous report ( #485407 ). 
I wanted to share this as a comment in my previous report but I cannot load the report.
Also this is a different bug so I think it is worth as a new report but feel free to count as you want.

I filed a complaint with H1 about that previous report. I seem to have broken it by posting the patch? Anyways, I agree this is an issue, thank you for pointing it out! I think the usual H1 practice here would be to affix this bug report to the previous report, since you're making the point that the previous fix was insufficient.

Perhaps I put it badly.
The fix was perfect. I couldn't reproduce the previously reported error. This error a completely different one but similar kind (PATH manipulation). In this report I don't use symbolic link or parent directory reference and I also target a different code path and I am using a different bug.
Do you agree?
It doesn't really matter to us one way or the other. From our perspective it's the same issue -- improper input checks on paths.

Okay!

I further tested this error and found another way to run commands. I used the *backtick* character to run arbitrary command. 
```
/Applications/Keybase.app/Contents/Resources/KeybaseInstaller.app/Contents/MacOS/Keybase --run-mode=prod --timeout=10 --debug --app-path='/Applications/Keybase.app/`id >> /tmp/test`' --install-cli
```
> Don't forget to open a new terminal to trigger the command. Also I don't escape the backtick characters because we are inside single quote.
Good point. I'm going to switch it over to a whitelist. Thanks for your help!

I tested (black-box test) the new version and it looks fixed. The only thing I noticed that I can set the path to a non existing or a valid but empty path causing denial of service (`keybase` and `git-remote-keybase` binaries will not found in `PATH`). Also I can call keybase helper with the `--uninstall-cli` flag resulting the same effect.
Good point, but we're OK with that.  I'll try to show you the PR without breaking HackerOne. It should hit our mainline after we get releases out today.
Here's the PR that we just merged and released today: https://github.com/keybase/client/pull/15898
Checked again and it's still looks OK!
Thank you for the great work!
